question: What is the another name of Vitamin C?
explanation: Vitamin C is also known as ascorbic acid and l-ascorbic acid. It is a vitamin found in various foods and sold as a dietary supplement. It is used to prevent and treat scurvy. It is necessary for the growth, development and repair of all body tissues. It\'s involved in many body functions, including formation of collagen, absorption of iron, the immune system, wound healing, and the maintenance of cartilage, bones, and teeth.
